title: Plans for Ezreal?
body: Any buffs for Ezreal? Ezreal is my favorate champion and for a while he has been left in the dust to stronger adcs/mid laners

replies.body: Ezreal feels like he fell a bit short of what we expected to see from him in the 5.22 preseason patch. We should look over him along with some others like Ashe, Sivir, and Twitch before the preseason ends. For him specifically, we nerfed some stuff to make room for the improved Q cooldown reducing effect as a precautionary measure, but it may not have been necessary.

I'm not sure what you expected would happen when you removed his ability to sustain his mana from Q range if he built essence reaver (which clearly was supposed to be a must buy on him), nerfed his CDs and put stats he doesn't care about that much into Triforce while also buffing the living shit out of many of other AD carries

Also please, for the love of god, give him a spellblade effect, a magic damage on-hit effect with a small AP ratio (3%-5%?) on his AAs that increases with how many stacks of his passive he has (it would be at 0% with no stacks, of course). Small but meaningful buff for AP Ezreal, who would now have a real reason to care about his passive and have a DECENT way to clear minion waves without actually getting waveclear, and a completely unnoticed buff for AD Ezreal ESPECIALLY with the removal of AP from Triforce.

We expected him to be fine, and he's honestly not super far off. He tends to sit at a lower-than-average win rate when considered balanced by us and most players.

op.gg has him at a 48.5% win rate over the last week in Korea, where he has always been and continues to be a very popular pick, so that seems like decent evidence that he's not _horribly_ far off. I don't think he requires much more than a slight adjustment, really.
So I guess that whole "winrates are not a sign of balance" goes out the window whenever it suits you guys doesn't it?
Basically this. It's pretty easy to have a conversation that starts at win rate and leads somewhere else, since win rate is likely the most obvious _baseline_ indicator of power.

Not the only.
Win rates when compared to pick rates. If Ezreal has a high pick rate (which he does in KR) and an average win rate (which, again, he does. Maybe just a little low), then that's a good sign.

Win rates are a sign of balance. They are a useful tool to gauge champion power. Riot have always said this.
They are not the be all and end all though. Riot don't just look at win rate (or Ez would be considered balanced only with a win rate of exactly 50%).
He isn't using it for balance.
Can he please have some utility back into his W someday? Because a plain base damage spell is sad.

It is sad, and we're not happy with it either. If we had the right low-cost approach (resources seem to mostly be allocated things at the moment), there may be something we could do. Of course there are things we _could_ do, but it's more a matter of finding a good long-lasting approach.

Here is what I know about Ez. His w and passive are pretty bad for ad, while for ap the passive is absolutely useless. Back when w slowed as it was a solid ability as it added options for ad and allowed ezreal to use his passive in trades when enemy ad's would try to all in him. Nowadays without the as slow the w and his passive are just...meh. So I can attack more as an AD CASTER, big whoop. It isn't like I'm corki where my Aas are hybridized in terms of output, so the faster attack speed doesn't matter because I'm suppose to be camping on the edge of fights slinging abilities to help my team instead of trying to auto attack. The solution to this dilemma is adding new complexity to the passive and adding more power into his w. 

To be quite honest the best way to strengthen the passive is to give it something else besides As. What I was thinking is that at 5 stacks ezreal next ability or attack causes an arcane explosion that does scaling damage with bonus ad or ap, whichever is higher. This would help with wave clear and help ezreal's abysmal dueling. The stacks would reset after this.

W is harder to balance. One part of me wants to keep the as steroid. But it is absolutely worthless as for the first part of the game the only champ getting it would be a support and/or jungle. It's why I think it would be better used for ezreal's theme. He is the prodigal explorer yet has no real exploration tools. Lengthen the range, add an ad ratio, and make it reveal things in a straight line. Remove the as steroid. And there you go. W is fixed, provides actual utility, and gives Ez some more security as in the current meta having a long cd blink that costs a lot of mana is not enough.

 Anyway that's my ideas. My other one was changing e to not just be a random shot but an Aa enhancer like vayne's tumble except it provides magic damage on next auto or q.

well, as far as the atk spd boost on ez's w... that's a relic from when his w actually had a thematic to it. Basically, when ez was released, his w boosted atk spd of allies and slowed the atk spd of enemies **as well as** dmg'ing enemies and **healing** allies.

basically, it was a 'kiss curse' thematic. do 1 thing to the enemy, and do the reverse to allies. But over the course of the years, ez's w has been stripped of what made it cool in the name of "balance" and thus we are left with the sad sad spell you see today.

On a ***completely*** unrelated note... OMG!! I did not know we had these!!! {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}  these are so awesome!!!

can we just make ez a mage? like pretty plz? I don't really understand why ez is an adc to begin with, other than his passive giving him atk spd. Everything else about his kit screams "mobile eluse poke mage or burst assassin" But for years everyone's been trying to force ez as some adc ad caster mash up that just leaves him very unrewarding and lack luster.

I'd honestly much rather see more focus be put into mid lane ezreal than the janky duo bot lane ez we see now.

What are your thoughts on that? and could you tell me your opinion at least, on the focus of ad ez over ap ez.

Things I really want to note as an ezreal main:

1. Leveling his W at all never feels satisfying or worth it when building AD, in lane the damage is negligent unless you max it and the mana cost is never worth the damage output at level 1 (it would be a different story if W had some kind of mana refund feature, but it doesnt). There is also very little utility on the W as I would have liked. Most of the time, I don't can't even tell the difference when I am using my W to give an ally an attack speed boost (this is different from nunu/warwick which has that obvious red glow). Similar to how sona used to be before her rework last year, the boosts your abilities are supposed to give feel "invisible". 

2. As an AD, his damage output is easily "turned off" simply by standing in front of him. Some champions, such as tristana, corki, twitch can simply jump or sneak past the front line and 1-2 shot the carries, but ezreal's damage source is generally stacked on his abilities and making his most damaging ability blockable just makes him less attractive as a reliable marksman.

3. mana is such an important stat, yet tear takes too long to stack up in the current preaseason where games snowball heavily and on-demand waveclear is almost mandatory so its almost always better to pick an ADC that can waveclear without needing to spend mana (guinsoo's rageblade alleviates this problem, but if ezreal is only as good as the items that are available then the item is too strong while the champion is too reliant on it. Nerfing guinsoos for example is a hard hit to ezreal at the moment). 

4. As an AP, he has a horrible laning phase and offers little to no CC in skirmishes, has a hard time securing kills during jungle ganks unless the jungler has cc in their kit, and takes a very long time to scale. Why would I play AP ezreal when I could play a different AP mage with similar mobility and more utility / better skirmish/teamfight  potential during this meta? {{champion:103}} {{champion:7}}

More ideas. Again maybe let his e poloriz the closest champ. So he can punish bad gankers with his double blink.

Secondly decrease the ad scaling on his e but allow how his e to crit. So building crit is more meaningful. 

Third would be increase the duration of his passive again. With the increase crit power items its even harder to keep it past 2 stacks unless you ult.

Since we are discussing Ezreal, can I ask for a quick clarification on his Q; it counts as an auto attack since it procs on hit effects (such as BORK) and does not proc magic effects (such as Deathfire Touch) - if this is the case, why does Sivir's Spell Shield absorb Ezreal's Q as if it were an ability, when clearly it's not.

Descriptions from Riot's website

Spell Shield:

Creates a magical barrier that blocks a single enemy ABILITY cast on Sivir. [...]

Deathfire Touch:

Your damaging ABILITIES cause enemy champions to take magic damage equal to [...]

At the very least there's a clarity issue, since Riot's own in-game interaction with Spell Shield would define Ezreal's Q as an ability. Since it deals damage, it is indeed a Damaging Ability. If it's a Damaging Ability, then it should proc Deathfire Touch.

About the Sivir. Every ability you shoot/cast on her will deny its effects.
[Link](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Spell_shield)

His W is also the most boring part of his kit when you run him AD.  One fix would be to give his W some AD scaling and some form of degrading damage wave clear like his ult.
